thread.title: UNH roundup: Volleyball wins eighth straight
thread.title_full: UNH roundup: Volleyball wins eighth straight

author: Staff reports sports@fosters.com
title: UNH roundup: Volleyball wins eighth straight
text: Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 11:12 PM By Staff reports Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 11:12 PM » Social News DURHAM — The University of New Hampshire volleyball team continued its winning streak eight, upending Stony Brook University in straight sets Saturday afternoon at Lundholm Gymnasium on Real 'Cats Wear Pink Day. New Hampshire’s seventh sweep of the season came by set scores of 25-17, 25-18 and 25-13. The Wildcats pushed their overall record to 14-7 and 6-0 in America East play. Stony Brook fell to 8-14, 4-2. New Hampshire has now tallied 17 straight victories over conference opponents. Seniors Cassidy Croci and Abby Brinkman eclipsed double digits in kills to lead UNH offensively. Croci slammed 12 kills on 23 swings with just two errors for a .476 hitting percentage. Brinkman landed 11 kills on 21 attempts with two errors to log a .391 clip. Junior setter Keelin Severtson directed the offense to a .297 hitting percentage, distributing 35 assists. The reigning America East Setter of the Week also added three service aces, three digs and two kills in the win. Senior defensive specialist Madison Lightfoot had 21 digs in the backcourt as Stony Brook was held to a .029 hitting percentage. The Seawolves were led by an eight-kill performance from senior outside hitter Kathy Fletcher. Women’s hockey can’t capitalize NORTH ANDOVER, Mass. — The University of New Hampshire women’s ice hockey team recorded a 35-12 shot advantage Saturday afternoon against Merrimack College, but the Warriors fended off UNH’s rally to record a 2-1 victory at Lawler Rink. UNH dropped to 0-4. Merrimack (1-4) picked up its first win of the season. Jonna Curtis scored at 12:02 of the third period to pull the Wildcats within 2-1, but they couldn’t find an equalizer. Goalie Ashley Wilkes, in her first action of the season, made 10 saves in defeat. Merrimack goalie Samantha Ridgewell backstopped the Warriors to victory with a 34-save effort, including 15 saves in the first period. Paige Voight and Jackie Pieper were the goal scorers, and Meghan Martin tallied two assists. Merrimack went up 2-0 with a short-handed goal early in the third period. The Wildcats got it back when Rochester’s Taylor Wenczkowski slipped a diagonal pass from the top-left circle down low to Curtis, who had lost her footing and was sliding on the ice but still fired a shot into the net. Amy Schlagel also assisted on the play. Swim team wins home opener DURHAM — The University of New Hampshire swimming and diving team upended the University of Vermont in its season-opener, 179-121, at Swasey Pool. The Wildcats placed first in 12 events and claimed the top two times on six occasions. Junior Sarah Broderick and sophomores Liza Baykova and Jessica Harper all merited four first-place wins. The performance was headlined by a pool record in the 400-yard freestyle relay by freshman Brittany Driscoll, senior Bettina Caspersen, Baykova and Broderick. The quartet finished the race in 3 minutes, 30.64 seconds, three seconds before any other squad. By Staff reports
